newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK overnight rate surges on year-end demand.
newsitem.headline: HK overnight rate surges on year-end demand.

text.p: The overnight money rate hit a morning high of 6-1/2 percent on year-end demand on Tuesday, but trade was very quiet as most participants already closed their books ahead of the New Year holiday on Wednesday, dealers said.
The overnight rate retreated slightly by midday to stand at 5-1/4 1/8 percent against 5 4-15/16 on Monday. Three-month was virtually unchanged at 5-9/16 7/16 percent.

"Trading has been very quiet on both bid and offer sides and there is also no direction from the U.S.," a local bank dealer said. He expected interbank rates and government paper yields to be steady after the markets reopen on Thursday.
Longer-dated government paper was little changed with almost no trading at all.
Three-, seven- and 10-year note yields were all unchanged at 6.02, 7.01 and 7.27 percent respectively.
One-month bill yields eased one basis point to 4.33 percent.
